page.title: 09FARMING 2
page.content: {BEEF PRODUCTION.} On steeper fields around Mobberley where farmers are unable to grow either crops or grass for conservation there are permanent pastures suitable for semi-intensive beef production where the dairy & beef animals are put to grass during the summer months and fed cereals and silage in-house during the winter. {FARMS-CHANGE OF USE.} Many of the farms in this area are tenanted from the Tatton Estate, others have been purchased by commuters who wish to live in the country but have no interest in farming. Most of the farms in this area fall into the second category and are owned by families whose income is derived from other industries than farming and many of them keep horses.
